Comment: He's got my vote and full support in the 2028 primary. IDGAF what anyone says, sure he's not a firey mic dropper like an AOC, but he has so many great qualities. Young, good looking, charming, Governor of a ruby red state, knows how to talk to voters the Democratic party struggles with, doesn't have the establishment stink on him or the coastal elite stereotype. Also he knows how to make politics simple and digestible, and meets voters where they are at  I absolutely love this dude and he would be the first guy I've ever heavily rallied around in a presidential primary in all seriousness.  I know he's an extremely polarizing figure for obvious reasons not arguing against any of them, but Andy Beshear has a lot of Bill Clinton like qualities (the good ones). He really does feel like a Jimmy Carter Bill Clinton type.  My dream ticket for 2028 is him with Ruben Gallegos, Reverend Warnock, JB Prtizker etc. This ticket feels like my only hope during these very dark times.

Comment: Yeah this one can be filed in the "no surprise" folder.  He's out as governor in January 2027. The timing couldn't be more perfect.  I think he's got a good shot. The primaries starting in SC is going to be very favorable towards southern candidates, especially those who have experience "campaigning" in black church basements. They're the core of the Democratic Party there. Winning southern Democratic primaries takes a very different style and different kind of politics. You've gotta connect with voters on an emotional level, like Biden did and like Obama did. That's going to make things considerably tougher for candidates like Buttigieg, Walz, and even Shapiro. Especially Pete, since he's so wonky and technocratic. That plays well with white liberals, but it falls flat as rock with black voters (generally speaking). His campaign tanked in SC last time.  Former NC Gov. Roy Cooper is another one I'd keep an eye on. His state borders and shares media markets with SC. He's got general election kudos, too. Twice-elected in a hefty swing state that would allow us to lose a blue wall state. That would be an enormous advantage in a general election.
